Despite the hateboner the whole internet seems to have for this game, its a pretty solid game. Sure, there are no lootboxes you can earn to get free cosmetics now and instead it has a shop and a battlepass. But that's the cosmetics, not the actual playable content.
Everything gameplay related is either unlockable by playing or directly free. And its not like if Overwatch was the one who invented this, every single free to play game does this. 
Seriously, if this game has caught your eye and you think it might be your thing, give it a try, dont let the internet ruin it for you.

This game is pay to win. You can either pay 10 dollars to unlock the new hero, or grind until level 45 in the battle pass.

If they removed that, the game would be a 6/10. However, with this pay-to-win element, the game is a 0/10. The game is also terribly balanced, Open Queue is really unfun and role queue isn't fun either because I may want to switch roles mid-game. 6v6 was more fun than 5v5 because it translated to less individual responsibility.
Blizzard revolutionised the concept of sequels by giving you the first game but with a bit less content.

[h1] Great Game, Terrible Management [/h1]
I'd like to state before I give this review that I am not negatively reviewing this game for the sake of review bombing. I'm not some butt-hurt TF2 fan who wants to watch this game die. While TF2 is my most played game and I would consider it my favorite game, for a long time Overwatch was my most played and favorite game. Some of my best gaming memories come from Overwatch. Everything negative I say in this review is out of disappointment in watching one of my favorite games dig its own grave. With all that out of the way, here are my thoughts on Overwatch 2.
[h1] The Positive [/h1]
Despite the negative review, I still really enjoy Overwatch. The core gameplay  is some of the most refined in the sub-genre of hero shooters. I think the switch from 6v6 to 5v5 is a very good decision because it keeps gameplay flowing with one less tank to lock down chokes. If you're here for just the gameplay and don't plan on spending any money, I would highly recommend this game.
[h1] The Negative [/h1]
Remember just a few seconds ago when I said I'd recommend this game to people who just care about gameplay and don't want to spend money? Well I sort of lied. You [b] can [/b] enjoy the gameplay without spending any money, if you're okay with grinding for hours to unlock all the heroes. Never owned Overwatch 1? You have to complete challenges to unlock all the Overwatch 1 heroes with the exception of a few that you start with. A new hero comes out? Have fun grinding to a ridiculous level on the battle pass to unlock them. Conversely, you could just buy the complete hero collection as well as battle pass tiers to instantly unlock all the heroes. It's incredibly frustrating to not have certain heroes because you just don't play very often and/or you didn't spend the money to unlock the heroes, especially since Overwatch character matchups work in a rock, paper, scissors style so not having a hero that counters an enemy's hero could cost your team the entire match, all because you didn't want to spend money. Some people may argue that since Overwatch 2 is Free to Play, it's fine that heroes cost money. However skins already exist to generate revenue for Overwatch 2, so gameplay doesn't have to be sacrificed for the sake of profit. Speaking of the monetization system, it's not very good. Instead of loot boxes, we have a battle pass. Battle passes are terrible, you pay for the battle pass probably only wanting one skin from it anyways, and you still have to grind the battle pass to get the skin. I never thought I would miss [b] loot boxes [/b], yet here we are. You can also buy the skins you want directly, if the skins you want are currently in the store, for $20 USD. The monetization is very greedy and entirely the fault of Blizzard. Speaking of things being Blizzards fault, the PvE mode that justified this sequel's existence is being cancelled, likely so Blizzard can move the hard working and talented development team away from the game they want and towards making a game that makes heaps of money at the expense of the players.
[h1] Conclusion [/h1]
If you're a fan of Overwatch 1 or looking for a good hero shooter, I give this game nothing but recommendation. It's still one of the best hero shooters ever made. Just don't spend any money on this game, because underneath this amazing shooter, lies a seedy underbelly of corporate greed. 

If you have any constructive criticism, counterarguments, or general comments feel free to leave a comment. I am open to and hopeful for insightful discussion. I'm not a professional reviewer so I'm sorry if my review is a little hard to understand or read.

Played for years, simply the best shooter in the market right now, people will complain about monetisation but the game is the same as any other free to play game, you gotta pay for some skins, and I repeat SOME, playing purely for free you'll get more cosmetics than you ever could playing shooters like Valo or CSGO. No other game has the same level of polish, complexity and hero diversity like Overwatch. Balance is good, any hero is viable at any rank, the only tough part is starting out, the skill floor for the game can be pretty unforgiving at times, but once you get over that hurdle, there's simply nothing like it.
